docs.title: 🤝 Contributing to QA Hub Actions
docs.text: We welcome contributions! Whether it's adding a new action, improving documentation, or fixing a bug, your help is appreciated.

docs.title: 🛠️ Development Workflow
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository and create your branch from main.
  2. Add your Action: Create a new folder with an action.yml and a README.md.
  3. Documentation: Add a corresponding .md file in docs/actions/ and update mkdocs.yml.
  4. Verification: Ensure your action follows the composite action standards used in this repo.

docs.title: 🖋️ Documentation Style Guide
docs.text: To maintain the "Premium" look of our wiki, please follow these standards: - Use Emojis in headers to improve scannability. - Include an "At a Glance" block at the top of every action page. - Provide clear Usage Examples in YAML blocks. - Use Tables for inputs and outputs.

docs.title: 🚀 Releasing
docs.text:
We use Semantic Versioning. PRs should follow the Conventional Commits specification to ensure automatic changelog generation and versioning.

Thank you for helping us build a better QA ecosystem!

docs.title: 🚀 Getting Started
docs.text: Standardizing your QA pipelines with QA Hub Actions is straightforward. Our actions are designed to be modular, reusable, and compatible with any GitHub repository.

docs.title: 📦 Installation
docs.text: Since these are GitHub Actions, there is no "installation" in the traditional sense. You simply reference them in your workflow files.

docs.title: Basic Implementation
docs.text:
Add a step to your .github/workflows/your-pipeline.yml:

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      # 1. Setup the environment
      - uses: carlos-camara/qa-hub-actions/setup-environment@main
        with:
          python-version: '3.11'
          node-version: '20'

      # 2. Run your tests
      - uses: carlos-camara/qa-hub-actions/run-tests@main
        with:
          test-command-api: "pytest tests/api"

docs.title: 🔐 Security & Permissions
docs.text: Most actions require the standard ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}. For actions that interact with external services (like Slack or AWS S3), you'll need to configure the appropriate Secrets in your repository settings.

docs.title: 🗺️ Pathing Standards
docs.text:
Our actions follow a "standard pathing" convention but are fully configurable. By default, they expect: - reports/ for test results. - requirements.txt for Python dependencies. - package.json for Node.js dependencies.

docs.title: 📊 Collect & Publish
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Core Engine
  • Complexity: Medium
  • Recent Version: v1.0.5 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: Unified Test Reporter

Aggregate test results, screenshots, and performance reports into a single, high-fidelity PR summary.

docs.title: 🏗️ Data Flow
docs.text:
graph LR
    A[API Results] --> E[Action Workspace]
    B[GUI Screenshots] --> E
    C[Perf Metrics] --> E
    E --> F[JUnit Aggregator]
    F --> G[GH Artifacts]
    F --> H[PR Comment Summary]

docs.title: 🛠️ Configuration
docs.text: Input Default Purpose reports-path "" Path to XML results. screenshots-path "" Pattern for PNG screenshots. junit-results-dir junit-results Internal folder for merging. upload-artifacts true Save files to GH storage. publish-results true Post summaries to PRs.

docs.title: 🔗 Integrated Screenshots
docs.text: When screenshots are found, the action uploads them as a specific artifact named gui-screenshots, making them easily accessible for visual regression review.

docs.title: 🧪 JUnit Merging
docs.text: The action automatically finds all .xml files in the reports-path, renames them to prevent collisions, and aggregates them into the junit-results-dir.

docs.title: ❌ No tests found in PR
docs.text:
Issue: The PR comment says "0 tests found". Solution: Verify that your test runner (Pytest/Behave) is actually generating JUnit XML files in the path provided to reports-path.

docs.title: 🌐 Deploy to GitHub Pages
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Reporting
  • Complexity: Low
  • Recent Version: v1.0.0 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: actions/deploy-pages

Effortlessly host your Node.js based QA dashboards or static reports on GitHub Pages with automated builds.

docs.title: 🏗️ Deployment Flow
docs.text:
graph LR
    A[Build Assets] --> B[Upload Artifact]
    B --> C[Deploy to Pages]
    C --> D[Live URL Generated]

docs.title: 🛠️ Inputs
docs.text: Input Default Purpose node-version 20 Environment for build. install-command npm ci Dependency prep. build-command npm run build Build generation. dist-dir dist Assets to deploy.

docs.title: ⚡ Deterministic Builds
docs.text: By using npm ci as the default install-command, the action ensures that your deployment environment exactly matches your package-lock.json, preventing "it works on my machine" issues.

docs.title: ❌ Permission Denied
docs.text:
Issue: Deployment fails with 403 error. Solution: Ensure your GITHUB_TOKEN has pages: write and id-token: write permissions in your workflow.

docs.title: ☁️ Deploy to AWS S3
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Reporting
  • Complexity: Medium
  • Recent Version: v1.0.1 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials

Securely archive your industrial-grade QA reports in AWS S3 for long-term retention and historical analysis.

docs.title: 🏗️ Storage Flow
docs.text:
graph TD
    A[Local reports/] --> B[S3 Bucket]
    B --> C[Project Folder]
    C --> D[Timestamped Index]

docs.title: 🛠️ Inputs
docs.text: Input Default Description project-name REQUIRED e.g., dashboard. s3-bucket REQUIRED Destination bucket name. aws-region us-east-1 Target region.

docs.title: 📂 Hierarchical Storage
docs.text: This action automatically organizes reports by project name, creating a clean structure: s3://bucket-name/project-name/runs/.

docs.title: 🔐 Security First
docs.text: The action sets up short-lived credentials, ensuring your AWS secrets are never exposed in plaintext during the deployment process.

docs.title: ❌ Bucket Not Found
docs.text:
Issue: Action fails to locate the destination. Solution: Verify the s3-bucket input exactly matches the bucket name in your AWS Console.

docs.title: 🔗 Link Checker
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Quality & Security
  • Complexity: Low
  • Recent Version: v1.0.0 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: Lychee

Maintain documentation integrity. Automatically scans your files for broken or dead links.

docs.title: 🏗️ Scanning Flow
docs.text:
graph TD
    A[Scan Files] --> B[Extract URLs]
    B --> C[Ping URLs]
    C --> D{Response == 200?}
    D -- No --> E[Report Broken Link]
    D -- Yes --> F[Ignore]

docs.title: 🛠️ Inputs
docs.text: Input Default Description search-path **/*.md Files/Patterns to scan. fail-on-error true Break build if link is dead.

docs.title: 🎯 Documentation Health
docs.text: Integrate this action into your main documentation pipeline to ensure that your wiki always points to valid resources.

docs.title: ❌ Transient Failures
docs.text:
Issue: External websites are temporarily down. Solution: If you have frequently failing stable links, consider adding them to an exclusion list if supported by your config.

docs.title: 🧶 Lint Codebase
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Quality & Security
  • Complexity: Medium
  • Recent Version: v1.5.0 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: Super-Linter

Unified linting engine that enforces a consistent style across Python, YAML, Markdown, and TS.

docs.title: 🏗️ Linting Strategy
docs.text:
graph LR
    Repo[Repository] --> Linter[Super-Linter]
    Linter --> Python[Black/Flake8]
    Linter --> YAML[Yamllint]
    Linter --> MD[Markdownlint]
    Linter --> Verdict[Pass/Fail Status]

docs.title: 🛠️ Inputs
docs.text: Input Default Purpose github-token REQUIRED For posting status checks. validate-all false Lint everything vs only changes. filter-regex-exclude (node_modules\|dist\|...) Paths to ignore.

docs.title: 🎯 CI Optimization
docs.text: Set validate-all: 'false' to only lint files that changed in the current Pull Request. This significantly reduces feedback time.

docs.title: 🧩 Custom Exclusions
docs.text:
If you have a vendor folder or legacy code, update the regex: 

with:
  filter-regex-exclude: "(.*/vendor/.*|legacy/)"

docs.title: ❌ MD041 Errors
docs.text: Issue: First line should be a top-level heading. Solution: Ensure every .md file starts with a # Title.

docs.title: ❌ MD007 Errors
docs.text:
Issue: Unordered list indentation errors. Solution: Standardize on 2-space indentation for nested lists.

docs.title: 📉 Performance Baseline
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Quality & Security
  • Complexity: Low
  • Recent Version: v1.1.0 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: JSON Compare Engine

Protect your UX. Automatically detect when API or GUI latency regressions exceed your tolerance.

docs.title: 🏗️ Logic Flow
docs.text:
graph TD
    A[Action Start] --> B[Load Current Metrics]
    B --> C[Load Baseline Metrics]
    C --> D{Regression > Threshold?}
    D -- Yes --> E[Fail Build]
    D -- No --> F[Pass Build]
    E --> G[Step Summary Report]
    F --> G

docs.title: 🛠️ Inputs
docs.text: Input Default Purpose current-metrics REQUIRED Path to JSON (e.g., perf.json). baseline-metrics REQUIRED Path to baseline JSON. threshold 10 Allowed % slowdown.

docs.title: 🎯 Tight Tolerance
docs.text:
For critical endpoints, set a lower threshold to catch even minor regressions: 

with:
  threshold: "5"  # Fail if 5% slower

docs.title: 📉 Report Example
docs.text: The action generates a rich table in your Job Summary: | Metric | Baseline | Current | Delta | Status | | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | | Search Latency | 120ms | 135ms | +12.5% | ❌ |

docs.title: ❌ JSON malformed
docs.text:
Issue: Action fails to read metrics. Solution: Ensure your test runner outputs a standard flat JSON object with { "metric_name": numeric_value }.

View Source Code

docs.title: 🏷️ PR Labeler
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Maintenance
  • Complexity: Low
  • Recent Version: v5.0.0 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: actions/labeler

Automatically triage Pull Requests based on the file paths that were modified. Keep your project organized without manual effort.

docs.title: 🏗️ Labelling Logic
docs.text:
graph TD
    A[PR Opened] --> B[Scan File Paths]
    B --> C{Matches labeler.yml?}
    C -- Yes --> D[Apply Label]
    C -- No --> E[Ignore]

docs.title: 🛠️ Inputs
docs.text: Input Default Description configuration-path .github/labeler.yml Rules file location. sync-labels false Remove labels if files revert.

docs.title: 📂 Configuration Example
docs.text:
Define your rules in .github/labeler.yml: 

DevOps:
  - ".github/workflows/**/*"
Documentation:
  - "**/*.md"

docs.title: ❌ Labels not appearing
docs.text:
Issue: PRs are opened but no labels are added. Solution: Verify the configuration-path is correct and that the labeler.yml follows the official syntax.

docs.title: 🚀 Python Auto-Release
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Maintenance
  • Complexity: Medium
  • Recent Version: v1.1.0 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: python-semantic-release

Automate your entire release lifecycle: Versioning, Changelog generation, Tagging, and GitHub Releases.

docs.title: 🏗️ Release Lifecycle
docs.text:
graph LR
    A[Analyze Commits] --> B[Bump Version]
    B --> C[Generate Changelog]
    C --> D[Create Tag]
    D --> E[GitHub Release]

docs.title: 🛠️ Inputs
docs.text: Input Default Purpose github-token REQUIRED To create Tags/Releases. python-version 3.11 Environment to run tool.

docs.title: 📝 Conventional Commits
docs.text: This action relies on Conventional Commits (e.g., fix:, feat:, feat!:) to determine the magnitude of the version bump.

docs.title: ❌ No release generated
docs.text:
Issue: Action completes but no tag/release is created. Solution: Ensure you are using the correct commit prefix and that the python-semantic-release configuration in pyproject.toml is present.

docs.title: 🧪 Run QA Test Suite
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Core Engine
  • Complexity: High
  • Recent Version: v1.2.0 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: Pytest / Behave / Locust

The unified execution engine for all your testing needs. High-concurrency support, service health checks, and standardized reporting stashing.

docs.title: 🏗️ Architecture
docs.text:
graph TD
    A[Action Triggered] --> B{Start Services?}
    B -- Yes --> C[Run start-services-command]
    B -- No --> D{Health Check?}
    C --> D
    D -- Yes --> E[Wait for health-check-urls]
    D -- No --> F[Execute Tests]
    E --> F
    F --> G[Stash Reports]
    G --> H[Action Completed]

docs.title: 🛠️ Configuration Details
docs.text: Input Type Default Description start-services-command String "" Command to start your app (e.g., npm start &). health-check-urls String "" Space-separated URLs to wait for (e.g., http://localhost:3000). test-command-api String "" Command for API tests (e.g., pytest tests/api). test-command-gui String "" Command for GUI tests (e.g., npm run test:gui). enable-coverage Boolean false Whether to collect code coverage.

docs.title: 📊 Coverage Mapping
docs.text:
When enable-coverage is set to true, the action automatically wraps your command with pytest --cov.

- uses: carlos-camara/qa-hub-actions/run-tests@v1
  with:
    test-command-api: "pytest tests/"
    enable-coverage: 'true'
    coverage-module: "app_logic"

docs.title: 🖱️ GUI Headless Control
docs.text:
Toggle between headless and headed execution using the headless parameter.

- uses: carlos-camara/qa-hub-actions/run-tests@v1
  with:
    test-command-gui: "behave features/"
    headless: 'false'  # Set to false for debugging

docs.title: ❌ Health check timeout
docs.text: Issue: The action fails during the "Wait for Services" step. Solution: 1. Increase the timeout in your app's startup or verify the health-check-urls are correct. 2. Ensure you backgrounded your app (e.g., using & in Linux).

docs.title: 🔍 Missing Reports
docs.text:
Issue: Tests pass but reports are not stashed. Solution: Standardize your test command to output to a folder named reports.

docs.title: 🛡️ Security Audit
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Quality & Security
  • Complexity: Low
  • Recent Version: v1.0.0 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: Safety / Bandit

Automated vulnerability scanning for your QA stack. Detects CVEs in dependencies and security anti-patterns in code.

docs.title: 🏗️ Security Flow
docs.text:
graph TD
    Start[Run Security Audit] --> Safety[Check dependencies with Safety]
    Safety --> Bandit[Scan code with Bandit]
    Bandit --> Report[Generate Security Report]
    Report --> Summary[Add to Step Summary]

docs.title: 🛠️ Parameters
docs.text: Input Default Description target-path . Directory to scan for code vulnerabilities. scan-dependencies true Toggle Safety check. scan-code true Toggle Bandit scan.

docs.title: 🚭 Excluding Paths
docs.text:
By default, the audit scans everything. To focus on your core logic: 

- uses: carlos-camara/qa-hub-actions/security-audit@v1
  with:
    target-path: "my_package/"

docs.title: 🚨 Failing the Build
docs.text: This action will fail the build if it finds High severity vulnerabilities, acting as a mandatory security gate for PRs.

docs.title: ❌ Known Vulnerabilities Found
docs.text:
Issue: Build fails due to security findings. Solution: - Safety: Update the failing dependency in requirements.txt. - Bandit: Review the reported line and apply recommended security fix (e.g., avoid eval(), use secure temp files).

View Source Code

docs.title: ⚙️ Setup Environment
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Core Engine
  • Complexity: Low
  • Recent Version: v1.1.0 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: setup-python / setup-node

One-stop configuration for multi-runtime QA projects. Automatic caching and dependency management for Python and Node.js.

docs.title: 🏗️ Architecture
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    participant GH as GitHub Runner
    participant Action as Setup Env Action
    participant Cache as GH Action Cache

    GH->>Action: Trigger (Python/Node versions)
    Action->>Cache: Check for dependency cache
    Cache-->>Action: Hit/Miss
    Action->>Action: Setup Runtimes
    Action->>Action: Run Install Commands
    Action->>Cache: Save new dependencies
    Action->>GH: Environment Ready

docs.title: 🛠️ Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Best Practice python-version e.g., 3.11. Leave empty if your project is pure Node. node-version e.g., 20. Leave empty if your project is pure Python. python-install-command CLI to install deps. Use pip install -e . for framework development. node-install-command CLI to install deps. Use npm ci for deterministic builds.

docs.title: 📦 Optimized Caching
docs.text: This action automatically caches pip and npm folders based on requirements.txt and package-lock.json. This typically reduces workflow time by 30-50%.

docs.title: 🛠️ Custom Tooling
docs.text:
If you need additional global tools, use the install commands: 

- uses: carlos-camara/qa-hub-actions/setup-environment@v1
  with:
    python-version: '3.12'
    python-install-command: "pip install black flake8"

docs.title: ❌ Python installation failure
docs.text:
Issue: pip fails to install dependencies. Solution: Ensure your requirements.txt is in the root directory or customize the python-install-command to point to the correct path.

docs.title: 📢 Slack Notification
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Reporting
  • Complexity: Low
  • Recent Version: v1.0.2 (Beta)
  • Primary Tool: Slack Webhooks

Keep the whole team in the loop. Posts rich summaries of test cycles directly to your Slack channels.

docs.title: 🏗️ Notification Flow
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    participant CI as GH Action
    participant API as Slack API
    participant User as Slack Client

    CI->>API: POST Webhook Payload
    API-->>CI: 200 OK
    API->>User: Display Rich Card (Success/Fail)

docs.title: 🛠️ Inputs
docs.text: Input Default Description slack-webhook-url REQUIRED Your channel's webhook URL. status success Result state (success/failure/cancelled). test-summary Tests passed Main message body.

docs.title: 🎨 Color-coded Alerts
docs.text: The action automatically changes the card color based on the status: - success -> Green ✅ - failure -> Red ❌ - cancelled -> Grey ⚠️

docs.title: 🔗 Deep Linking
docs.text: The notification automatically includes a direct link to the GitHub Action run that triggered it, saving developers valuable seconds during triage.

docs.title: ❌ 404 No Service
docs.text:
Issue: Webhook call fails. Solution: Verify the webhook URL hasn't expired or been deleted in Slack's App management.

docs.title: 📤 Upload Results to Repo
docs.text:
At a Glance

  • Category: Reporting
  • Complexity: Low
  • Recent Version: v1.0.0 (Stable)
  • Primary Tool: Git

Commit and push consolidated test reports directly to a dedicated branch or folder within your repository.

docs.title: 🏗️ Commit Flow
docs.text:
graph LR
    A[Reports Dir] --> B[Git Add]
    B --> C[Git Commit]
    C --> D[Git Push]

docs.title: 🛠️ Inputs
docs.text: Input Default Purpose run-id REQUIRED Source workflow ID. branch REQUIRED Target git branch. upload-reports true Process XML results.

docs.title: 🔄 Automatic Sync
docs.text: This action is ideal for keeping a "latest" documentation folder in sync with the actual results from the main branch.

docs.title: ❌ Git Conflict
docs.text:
Issue: Pushes fail due to remote changes. Solution: This action uses a force-push strategy on designated reporting branches to ensure visibility is always current.
